    • Method Detail

      • checkForHoldAdditions

        void checkForHoldAdditions()
        Determine whether any entities (eg: accounts, policies, producers) have become a target of this Hold since the last time this Hold was persisted. If so, notify any newly held entities so they can perform any necessary business logic after hold release.

        There are two ways that a hold can be released:

        1. A HoldType can be added to a hold. Doing that will affect all HoldRelatedEntity objects (accounts, producers, policies...) that were targeted by the Hold

        2. A HoldRelatedEntity (account, policy, producer) can be added to a hold. Doing that will add to that entity from all Hold Types which are enabled

      • checkForHoldReleases

        void checkForHoldReleases()
        Determine whether any entities (eg: accounts, policies, producers) have been released from being a target of this Hold since the last time this Hold was persisted. If any have been released, invoke afterHoldRelease on any held entities that were released from the Hold so they can perform any necessary business logic after hold release

        There are two ways that a hold can be released:

        1. A HoldType can be removed from a hold (examples: Invoice Sending, Commission Payment). Doing that will release all HoldRelatedEntity objects (accounts, producers, policies...) that had been targeted by the Hold for that particular HoldType

        2. A HoldRelatedEntity (account, policy, producer) can be removed from a hold. Doing that will release that entity from any and all Hold Types that are enabled for the Hold

        This method will check for hold releases caused by both of the above mentioned release mechanisms. For any released hold, the method will go invoke afterHoldRelease() on each hold related entity (eg: account, policy, or producer) that was released from the hold

      • isAppliedToHoldType

        boolean isAppliedToHoldType(HoldType holdType)
        Returns true if this Hold indicates we should block the automated process associated with a particular HoldType
        Parameters:
        holdType - a type of automated process blocked by a hold (for example: Late Fees or payment of Producer Commission)
        Returns:
        true if this Hold indicates we should block the automated process associated with the hold type passed into this method

      • setAppliedToHoldType

        void setAppliedToHoldType(HoldType holdType,
                        boolean applyToHoldType)
        Sets whether this Hold should block the automated process associated with a particular HoldType
        Parameters:
        holdType - a type of automated process blocked by a hold (for example: Late Fees or payment of Producer Commission)
        applyToHoldType - true if this Hold should block the automated process represented by the hold type that was passed in,
